benchmark_details.name: Comprehensive Benchmark for Radiology Report Generation
benchmark_details.overview: This study presents a comprehensive benchmark to evaluate the performance of instruction-tuned Vision-Language Models (VLMs) in the specialized task of radiology report generation across three low-resource languages: Italian, German, and Spanish.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate the performance of instruction-tuned Vision-Language Models (VLMs) in generating radiology reports in low-resource languages and to determine the effectiveness of language-specific and domain-specific adaptations.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The study's scope was limited to a single dataset and three non-English languages, potentially limiting the generalizability of findings.

data.source: IU-Xray dataset consisting of 7,470 chest X-ray images paired with 3,955 radiological reports.
data.annotation: Reports translated from English into Italian, German, and Spanish.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on comparisons of generated reports to reference reports to evaluate quality.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in BLEU and ROUGE metrics indicate better lexical and semantic alignment with reference reports.
methodology.validation: Standard dataset split of 70% for training, 10% for validation, and 20% for testing.
